Reviews.Title: “BLACK MOLD!!”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: We came for only one night, got to our 3 rooms, dropped our things in the rooms and took off. What little time the night we arrived that was spent in the room was simply getting ready quickly to go out, Our kids in the second two rooms did the same. When checking in, my wife and our friend filled out the papers according to the helpful woman behind the counter. Only people she bothered to "register" was my wife and our friend. There was nine of us altogether. At 3 am when my daughter and one of her friends that were staying in the room tried to go up, the night watchman refused one of them entry, saying she was not registered. I tried to resolve the situation by signing her in, and I was told that although he was the night manager, he cannot do that, as the desk was closed. While the man was extremely polite and nice, it was horrid. My daughter had to sort their belongings and drive back home at 4am in order for one of the guests with us to have a place to sleep. (Thankfully we only live 45 min away.) In the morning, when we awoke, a few of us were suffering from breathing issues. Upon full inspection in bright daylight ALL THREE rooms have quite a bit of black mold everywhere. In the bathrooms, on the drop ceiling tiles (Who puts a drop ceiling in a SHOWER??) It was VERY disgusting. One of the ladies behind the desk was rude, accusatory towards us, and trying her best to make it out that we were in some way lying. The owner/manager refused to sort anything out with us at all. While he was not rude in any manner, he was still not helpful. He even seemed to try to make me think that simply due to the humid nature of the area, all the hotels have these issues. I disagree, and I am sure other operators in the area will quickly say he is full of it. If you have ANY type of breathing issues, DO NOT STAY HERE!!! You are placing yourself at a health risk. I plan on taking these pictures to the city and county health department.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Winston622
Reviews.Content: Omg. This place is a DUMP!!! The front desk people are sooo rude, the rooms might even be worse. The rooms are sooooo dirty and I might have bed bugs. The front door to the hotel doesn't even work, if you need to check in early or even on time, dont count on it. This place is a hole in the wall. I would rather stay on the beach...at least I wouldn't get bed bugs!!! BEWARE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad location if thats what your after.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick R
Reviews.Content: The hotel workers were friendly, There was good parking behind the building. The room was clean, We didnt like the fact we had no WIFI. But we didnt come to use the internet. Hotel pool was nice, and the front porch is covered with rocking chairs, makes a great spot to sit and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: Linsy L
Reviews.Content: I have to say some people on here are BEYOND dramatic. I went for the weekend Aug 3-5 with my boyfriend & 10 month daughter. The people at the front desk were extremely friendly & made me feel right at home. Our room was suprisingly pleasant. It had a queen bed, tv, microwave, & mini fridge. It was rather small but not so small you're knocking into stuff. We even managed to put my daughters little playpen in their so it couldn't be THAT small. The room WAS clean when we got there & so was the bathroom. It did get dirtier through out the stay but it's our own fault for refusing room service. The maids were friendly & did ask if we needed anything yet we always refused. They usually asked when my daughter was asleep ha. The location is awesome, right on the boardwalk. You don't hear any of the boardwalk noise though which is a plus. The pool was a good, small, but nice. I did spend a lot of time in the hotel & my boyfriend always went downstairs to the shop which was very useful. Its a short drive to CVS & Layton's also. The only con I can say is the parking. The lot right behind the hotel is extremely small & even if you do get a parking spot, it's takes a while to actually get out. There is additional parking but you have to cross two roads & it's quite difficult with a child. So if you get parking right behind the hotel i would suggest you don't move it. Overall it was a great trip in a cheap, warm, hotel. Maybe I'm not half as picky as some people but you're at ocean city. I'm suprised you're not complaining about the sand on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Dingy but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 22Pride
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an apartment for a week. The only thing this place has going for it is the location. It is very obvious the establishment has been left go for a very long time without any updates. Even outdated would be fine if it was at least clean. Very dirty carpets & tiles. Mold on the grout in the bathrooms. Then to top it off the service is terrible. The desk staff are rude. Asked to speak with a manager yet none around & none bothered to call us after we left a message with the desk. My advice is to spend the extra bucks & stay somewhere else with a little more quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best location with an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Sealiz29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic from 7/13-7/16 and loved it. Rooms are a little small but it fit it's purpose. Close to everything! This hotel is very basic and doesn't have the amenities you would find at the Ritz or Hilton chain. Rooms are clean and quiet. I had ocean view room. My favorite part was the front porch with the rocking chairs. Sitting there relaxing and watching the ocean view and boardwalk goers. I would definitely stay here again. Hotel staff very friendly & accommodating. So close to the beach and in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location, responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: DanielleC02
Reviews.Content: Majestic Hotel is a great value. Its located right on the boardwalk and close to everything you could want or need in OC. We stayed in a room that had a double bed and a twin. It was perfect for our little family of 3. Upon arrival we were allowed to check in early- which was awesome! Not many OC hotels are that accomidating. When we entered our room my son discovered the bathroom light was not working. I'm glad he noticed so soon. We alerted the front desk and it was fixed within 2 hours. It would have been fixed sooner, but they needed to go get a part. The other little annoyance is on Sunday morning we woke to no hot water. The front desk said they were aware and they were working on it right now. Apparently the heating element went out on the hot water heater. One great thing that is not always present in oc was GREAT water pressure. Over all we would def. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: kelee79
Reviews.Content: The Majestic doesn't pretend to be a fancy, high-class hotel. It is exactly what they tout themselves as - an older hotel, on the boardwalk, with nothing extra. The hotel is clean, in a fantastic location, and offers a nice place to lay one's head at the end of the day. I stayed with a friend in July, 2012. We stayed for only one night, and had a one-bed room. The room was very small - again, exactly as we expected. Yes, things are outdated - no fancy new tvs, out-dated decor - but we didn't go there expecting the Ritz. The front desk still uses a typewriter instead of a computer. There are actual keys instead of keycards. It is like going back in time - but in a good way. The rocking chairs on the porch are very enjoyable - a nice place to sit and people-watch. The only issue we had was a toilet that would not shut off. We called the front desk, and the maintainence guy was there within 2 minutes to fix it. Additionally, we were parked in by another car in the parking lot - not the hotel's fault - but when we called to tell them, the front desk guy literally RAN outside to find out who the car belonged to, called that other client, and had them move the car. Bottom line, if you are looking for a cheap hotel just for a place to sleep and shower, this will be fine. If you're looking for something fancy, it's not going to be the place for you. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Jack0906
Reviews.Content: I’m reading the bad reviews and I have to say what planet are you from! This is OC not Hawaii; you’re paying 150 a night not 500! I’ve been staying at the Majestic for about 30 years. It’s family run and has been for at least three generations. I’ve stayed at literally dozens of places in OC from condos to the Holiday Inn and they’re all about the same. Some are a little nicer than others, but you pay for the privilege. If you want to spend all of your time in your room go somewhere else OC is not for you! The beach is the best on the East Coast. I like the Majestic because the location is super! At 7th and Boardwalk you’re far enough away from the Inlet noise yet close enough to all of the action. I know I can walk down to the Purple Moose and hear some live music or walk in the other direction and have a good meal at Phillips. When you come back the Majestic you can sit outside on the deck in a rocking chair just watching the people walk by. For me after I’ve rocked for a while I usually go to my room and collapse only to awake the next morning to start all over again. I believe that the Majestic is a bargain probably the best bargain on the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “hotel rooms are ok”
Reviews.Author: kimike611
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with 2 kids in summer 2011, although the rooms are outdated, the place is in a great location. one good thing about it is you dont need elevator to get to room. we stayed in the first room on the left at the top of the steps, so it was very easy in and out all day long. simple, friendly, outdated with small bathroom, but we are hardly in our room so works for us! prob would stay here again. i like how they make teens wear a wrist band so they know if you are from the hotel or not. good idea to keep others from coming and going in since so close to boardwalk!!

Reviews.Title: “Apartments are nasty.”
Reviews.Author: cindycPasadena_MD
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in one of the apartments owned by the Majestic Hotel. We were horrified when we walked in. So outdated and creepy. The furniture was quite worn. The mauve carpeting has burn marks on it from cigarettes. Funky smell. The 2 bedrooms were so small that they could barely fit the double beds and dresser. Had to turn off the window A/C at night because it blew right in you face. When it got hot I turned it back on and put the covers over my head. Kitchen was carpeted with some gray fuzzy stuff with contact paper on the walls. Toaster did not automatically pop up so the 1st time we used it our toast got burnt. Some of the forks in the drawer looked like they had not been washed from the last tenant. Refused ot cook anything in the kitchen so ate out every night which defeated the purpose of having an apartment. One bathroom was so dated that we refused to use it. The paint on the vanity was peeling off. Thank got the second bath was updated and was ok to use. Only thing good about this place is the location and the pool was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: teresa m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and couldn't wait to get home and shower. The place was old and smelled like rotting food. The room was small and dirty. After the first day of what they considered "cleaning" by the housekeeping staff, I had to go to the front desk and request that the staff actually clean the bathroom. The sink and bathtub were still dirty from use. NOTHING was wipped clean and there was hair in the tub. The only thing they did was give us new towels. I also had to request that they vaccuum the floor. Apparently the obvious sand all over the floor was not enough for them to do it. What hotel at the beach doesn't vaccuum the floor everyday?? Even after these request, I found the same problems the next day!! The only benefit of this place is location. I would never stay there again nor would I ever recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: lilcookie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Majestic. The hotel, and especially the room, was clean. The hotel is old, built in 1925, but the A/C was new, the room had been painted/papered recently, carpet appeared to be relatively new. Our room was small, but for just the 2 of us, it was OK. The bed was not the most comfortable. The room had a frig and microwave, the tub had been updated and the shower worked well. There is only one dingy elevator, staff was friendly. The best thing about this hotel is the location, right on the boardwalk, and there is a lovely porch with rockers where you can sit, chat, and peoplewatch, all at a reasonable price. I would stay there again.You might say it could use a facelift, but then it wouldn't look like a hotel from the 20's. As long as it is clean and the staff is helpful, I think it is a reasonable alternative to spending big bucks to stay in other more modern places.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would consider going back”
Reviews.Author: guaterambo
Reviews.Content: We planned a short vacation time in Ocean City, MD with very little advance and we didn't want to spend a lot of money but found the Majestic on line and called for a reservation. (they only accept reservations over the phone) Staff person on the phone was very helpful. We are a family of five (children ages 18, 14, 10) so we stayed at one of their larger rooms that have two double beds and a sofa bed type. The room was very clean and smelled like clean. We knew it only had a small fridge and one bathroom so we were OK with that. Room service was good. It is literally in front of the boardwalk and therefore in front of the beach. It didn't have noisy businesses in front so it was very quiet at night. We loved the front porch with the rocking chairs to just chill out at night. It has a nice parking lot right beside it and if it gets full, they have an additional one two blocks away which is not bad. It also has a small pool. Majestic doesn't have internet neither a great TV and availability of channels, but I wouldn't plan going to Ocean City MD to watch great TV or check email! Consider this option if you are thinking of a place to stay, rest at a clean affordable place and retreat from the noise of the city. There will be plenty of things to do in and around Ocean City, MD

Reviews.Title: “wont stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jdipko
Reviews.Content: Kitchen is horriably non-equipped. Location is nice but very disappointed with how DIRTY it was not a clean place at all for what we paid will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, Horrible Parking!”
Reviews.Author: Disgrunteled33
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there recently and found the staff to be wonderful. They were very friendly, and helpful! The problem was the parking lot is EXTREMELY small and only one car can enter or exit at a time. The number of cars that fit in the lot is not enough for the size of the hotel. The overflow lot is just as bad. The one car we could park on the lot BARELY fit and it was EXTREMELY difficult to get it out when we wanted to go anywhere. There were even cars parked in the lot that were not supposed to be and we were told the cars were being towed however, they NEVER were. I would NOT recommend this hotel because the parking was SO bad!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Worst Worst”
Reviews.Author: Ketujoshi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has nothing beside the view but that You can get at Crystal Beach Hotel Which is much nicer with Balcony. We stayed at Majestic for one day & next day we checked out cause they have nothing ....nothing...nothing. Worst Manager in Hotel Industry.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: flowers85
Reviews.Content: The Place was run down. We rented one of the apt. We got there and the place had never been cleaned from the last people that rented it. beer cans under the beds. Food wraps in chairs. Carpets was dirty. Two of the dinner chairs were broken with pieces laying on the floor. You would have thought they would have change them out before we got there. The tile was broken on the floor so they put a throw rug on top of it. Here's a tip how about fix it. We also had a 2x4 as our lock for the sliding glass door. When we called to rent the place and they new it was a family trip they could have told us that the month of June was high school senior time, but of course its all about money. Just fyi would have been good. We complained for 3 day nights because what seemed like the wwf next door. They finally were kicked out due to have 20 some kids in their room and the max was 10. They do not follow their own lease. Why have a lease if they are not going to follow it.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: acyoungstownohio
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in apartments, which were on the 4th. floor. They did not inform us about being on the 4th. floor .The apts were filthy and we ask them to be recleaned they were still bad. Also there was not even toilet paper in the room. We had to provide our own which would have been fine if we were told. Also if you walked on floors barefooted your feet were black not kidding i cound'nt belive they asked top dollar for this rental. And it only gets worse, lightbulbs were missing no towel racks holes in the wall for air conditioner vents, 2x4 was used to lock sliding doors, couches smelled ,wrapper, trash in furniture, also we were there senior week they had apartment next to us or should I say animal house next to us, which management did nothing about until we complained for two days, the only positive was the veiw that saved our vacation, staff and management were horrible and didnt care.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Older Hotel On The Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: playingatthebeach
Reviews.Content: I had relatives come to visit us at the beach in September 2010. The rooms they stayed in were very CLEAN and NICE. We sat on the porch in the rocking chairs talking, enjoying the great view of the beach and watching the sights on the boardwalk for hours. It was very relaxing. Also the pool is nice and clean, great for the kids. My family will stay here AGAIN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “accomodating for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: 73cuda
Reviews.Content: very accomadating,parking before and after check in. Nice staff,clean rooms with the basic essentials. Didn't like the creepy elevator and the water pressure in the shower was terrible. Lost hot water during shower both days. Good for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: lilwheelie
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not I didnt get a chance to stay here. We made reservations but quickly had to cancel the next day - three weeks before our stay. My credit card (debit) was however CHARGED (policy I am told) and when I called to get it taken care of (6 days after the charge) I was told Will, the manager didnt get a chance to do it yet. When asking the receptionist Stacie, when her manager was going to be back I was rudely told "I dont know, I cant tell you". No one else was there to speak to & only after saying I was going to call back ever hour on the hour did I get he wont be back today - try tomorrow. I am on day seven of trying to get my money back with absolutely no help from this hotel or it sad staff.

Reviews.Title: “Understanding management, decent for price”
Reviews.Author: bhemp5
Reviews.Content: One of three hotels that had vacancy for this past weekend. For the price, it was clean, great location on the beach and boards, but the rooms are totally outdated. They need to invest a lot into this property. When I called in the reservation, the girl answering could barely speak English. She wrote down the wrong date for the check in. When I called in on the way down, they said, "your reservation was for yesterday" I told them that was impossible and that the girl wrote it down wrong because she could barely understand me. They told me that I was gonna be charged an additional $44 because they were putting us in a bigger room, but I objected saying that "if you went to restaurant and ordered a hot dog, the waiter brings you a filet mignon and then charges you for their filet, who in their right mind would pay for the filet?" The staff said I needed to speak to the manager the next morning, which I did and he did the right thing by refunding my $44 back. Good parking, room is old, but after rockin beers at Seacrets, you won't care. All good....

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little money, and maybe listen to your customers.”
Reviews.Author: NeseeDCoy
Reviews.Content: Good Lord, where to start? We've been staying in the apartments for several years, and I think this year could be our last. These people refuse to spend a dime to fix the place up a little, and either don't pay their staff well, or just don't care about the job that they do. We had pieces of trash and wrappers in various places in the room, beds are NOT comfortable, the sliding door didn't work properly (had to fight and cut up your fingers to get it closed), and the A/C froze up our first 4 days there. As for the front desk, while they weren't all out rude, they did as little as possible. On one trip to report our a/c not working, the guy said "What do you want me to do?" - Gee, I don't know, call someone to fix it??? After many trips over for the a/c problem, they started to lie and say they had no way to reach the manager. Did not appreciate that. We reported the A/C each day, and we were told it was a) turned down too low (bull) b) we must be leaving windows/doors open c) it's so humid at the beach, you can't open windows. Uhhhh, we did NOT open windows. Once in awhile the door was open, because we couldn't close it! And by open, I mean 2 inches. We politely suggested to the manager, that the a/c needed freon, and the filter was filthy (we looked at it). He insisted it was just cleaned, and did NOT need freon. Well, we had 2 maintenance men in the room with us, and while they aren't experts, it was pretty obvious with it freezing up. We even took pictures of the blocks of ice. One of the other units outside was also freezing up. Nobody was even in that apartment, so the "windows open" excuse was crap. Well, I started to get irate by Day 3. I did not pay $3,000 for a vacation with no a/c. The manager was quick to tell me that they do not do refunds or price adjustments. No matter that I've been a loyal customer. FINALLY, I guess he found a brain, called in an HVAC guy that said.........guess what?...........needs freon. I swear, the manager (owners son) has been instructed to make excuse after excuse to not spend money, even if it means a $3,000 loss the following year. As for the sliding door, he did scrape some sand out of the track, which made it work a slight better. We suggested cleaning the rollers, at which time he said there were no rollers on the door. Another lie. We could SEE the rollers. He just didn't want to remove the door, and fix it. We did not appreciate being lied to, or someone thinking we're too stupid to know the a/c needs freon, and the dang door has rollers. He also promised to come back and work on the door after the a/c was fixed. He never came back, and I was so irritated at that point, I didn't really care. The dryer was broken the entire time we were there (the part is on order). I guess they don't realize that a 30 year old dryer could likely be replaced for about as much as the part and labor. Also, our vacuum was broken, but it was replaced with another one.....2 days after asking. Previous comments are correct about the floors. Disgusting. Walk through the apartment a few times, and your feet are black. We are very sad that it has come to this, because while we've always viewed it as "old" or "quaint", we now view it as disgusting. Our neighbor (that will never come back - they had mold in their room) suggested that they refuse to spend any money, and they're just waiting for a large hotel to come along and buy it. I get that, but in the meantime, please, please, PLEASE spend just a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Aviod the apartments / they are rundown and filthy”
Reviews.Author: PaFamily1
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Majestic apartments every other year for the past 10 years. The apartments have been getting worse every time. The furnishings are the same since the first stay, chewing gum shoved down in the couch. Dirt and debris found under the dressers furniture and beds. The floors are so dirty your feet will be black from walking on them. Light fixtures were falling off the ceilings in the 2 of the three bedrooms. The tile in one of the bathrooms is broke / missing, they covered them with a throw rug. The stove had a gas leak; we shut off the gas supply, when we notified the front desk at check out, they did not comment except to make sure we turned in both keys. The calking around the tub is missing. The TV is about a 20-24 inch with a hole in the cabinet on the front. The "furnished" utensils are broke and are not a complete set. The apartment was not clean on arrival, we had to run the vacuum, and it also had to be replaced while we were there. We paid around 3100 for the week, a terrible amount for this place. Do your self a favor and stay elsewhere. A tradition has been changed; our family has decided not to stay there anymore. What a travesty for a location that was rich in memories, now run to the ground because it is not maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, antiquated but quaint!”
Reviews.Author: TowsonGirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Majestic several times, however, usually in September when the crowd thins out a bit. This was our first time "in season" and were surprised at the rates given the age of the hotel. We still enjoyed our stay, but the sheets were never changed and this is something you expect no matter how long the stay (ours was Friday through Monday). We were happy to see that some updates were made to the room since our last visit, however the bed was extremely uncomfortable (backache material). We also visited during "code red" weather, and found upon arrival that the A/C was not turned on for us. After carrying our luggage in the heat to the elevator and to our "extremely hot" room, one could say we were not very pleased nor felt welcomed! While I totally understand the need to conserve, I would strongly recommend that especially during this type of weather that the A/C be turned on for guests prior to arrival! The water pressure and temperature was also a "big" problem, pressure was almost non existent and we could never get proper temperature, either you were getting scalded or frozen and had to run to the back of the shower. Not real pleasant when you were just coming from the beach and looking forward to a comforting shower! All said, I would visit again, but call in advance to make certain to ask that the A/C be turned on for us, and if the water issues had been corrected. Bring you pillows from home, you will sleep a bit better! We never used the pool, although we tried several times. It was small and very crowded. Since no one watches the pool nor checks to see if you are a guest it does appear that non guests are using it.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Delmiss
Reviews.Content: I stay here cause every else was booked good location but when we got to our room it was small smelly like mold weird smell well I askedfir double and when we got to our room it was a twin bed and a full the lady told us that there was no other room so I had to pay to get a rolled bed to our room which it barely fit. Omgthe bathroom was sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo small the shower didn't work we had to use a cup to shower You could here every nosie in the hall which wokeme up in the middle if the night the pool is small the parking suck there is parking behide the hotel. We went to dinner cameback late there was no parking behide the hotel it was full well their second parking is 3 blocks away the location is great close to the beach on the boardwork but wouldn't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not picky, but wouldn't stay here again. . .”
Reviews.Author: RobandLeah
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Ocean City this past weekend. . My husband had been going there for years and I had never gone to OC before. . Neither one of us had stayed on the Boardwalk, or at this hotel before. The pictures online looked nice, and the price for the location was excellent, so we booked 5 nights here. The place is extremely old. It's not the cute, charming old that you want to take pictures of. . it's the old that you want to walk out of and not return to. . the smell you get when you open an attic, of must, humidity, and amonia. . I guess the negatives of the hotel were: The lobby was empty for the most part, and the staff was very scarce and unattentive. When you did find someone, however, they were nice, if you needed ice, or whatever. The pool is out back by the parking lot, and it's on the small side. . . there are filthy chairs surrounding the pool and a few tables with umbrellas. . . however, no one from the hotel watches the pool so it seemed like OC locals were just coming and swimming and then leaving the two times we went to the pool. Like I stated before, the hotel is really old and doesn't smell too nice... the rooms were very dated . . the bedspread was gross and I didn't use it to cover up with. . the sheets weren't changed our entire stay, I know this because there was a stain on the bottom corner and it was there all 6 days. Also we were told we'd have a queen size bed and we had a double. . and it wasn't comfortable at all. Anyhow, I guess some positives would be: the view from the room is sweet, all water and boardwalk! The AC really worked well both in the lobby and in the rooms (which is suprising given the condition of the hotel). . . The bathroom was adequate, it took a minute or two for the hot water to start, but once it did, it stayed nice and hot for the duration of my shower, and the pressure wasn't anything to complain about. . The porch out front with the rocking chairs is VERY charming. Loved sitting there in the evening and watching people! The TV worked well at night when we put it on, but the alarm clock looked so dated, I haven't even seen one like it before, so you might want to set the alarm on your cell!!!! Oh and there aren't any outlets in the wall, Had to use a power strip for cell phone chargers and digital camera battery charger. .bring your own blowdryer because there aren't any in the rooms. Lastly, the hotel has the main entrance on the Boardwalk and then a side entrance which is probably 20 feet from the pool and where you park, which was nice because you didn't have to walk in dripping wet or covered in sand through the lobby, you could just enter the side door and get right into the elevator. Overall, the hotel was nothing to write home about, and we probably would not stay here again. The Boardwalk location was great, but the hotel really wasn't. . .

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good but the shower!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scurran5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The price per night is very reasonable in comparison to others in O.C. The pool was small but nice. This is an older hotel so fixtures and things are not up to date. The beds were comfortable for all of us (my husband, 11 yr old daughter & myself). However, the shower was awful! It was clean but had almost no water pressure! There was about 3 trickles coming out! We complained and they promptly changed our shower head. Unfortunately, it made no difference! It took at least 10 minutes to wash out shampoo and forget about conditioner! My husband resorted to rinsing off with a cup from the sink! Not to mention the little bit of water we had would go from steamimg hot to ice cold in 2 seconds flat. Upon checking out there others at the front desk complaining about having no water pressure as well. I would stay here again only if they assured me the water pressure problem was fixed!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for Price”
Reviews.Author: LovesMexicoLancPa
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of September 25th - Sun Fest weekend. I was very nervous after reading some of the previous reviews but making a late reservation for a sold out weekend, kept us from being able to stay at the Boardwalk (our very favorite in OC). The hotel is dated but I found the room to be average - no frills, no amenities except soap. I saw no noticeable house-keeping problems other than the bathrooms are old and when you have tile, it is hard to have a fresh appearance (I always spray Lysol all over just to be sure). The staff we came in contact with were cordial, certainly not unfriendly. Bedspreads are becoming so taboo - and I always throw mine on the floor anyway. The air conditioner was new and the TV worked well.. The bed was in dire need of a new matress and pillows. The carpet appeared to be pretty new free of any stains. The rates are low - and as they say - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.........”
Reviews.Author: topdogceo
Reviews.Content: I knew ahead of time the building was old, but the price to be on boardwalk and 7th street was so appealing. And that's exactly what it was, the building is old not a lot of upgrade done to the rooms in a long time. But the room was large, clean and overall for the location I'd stay again. The front desk people weren't the most friendly people I've met, but I never really needed anything so they were not rude either. The beds were okay, we had two doubles which honestly isn't really big enough for two people but we made do. But I did love the location to just wake walk outside and be right at the beach and on the boardwalk for a affordable price was great. The pool was small but clean and private. The place has a elevator everything worked fine. Shower wasn't the greatest pressure wize and sometimes it was to hot or cold but there wasn't anything we couldn't work around. If your not willing to work around this stuff it won't be the place for you. I loved the front porch and the rocking chairs, weather was great and the porch was awesome. Over all we had a great family trip.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler09
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is an old hotel - very basic in its amenities. We had a corner ocean front room and the view was fantastic. I found the room to be clean and the beds to be comfortable. We had a small refrigerator and a microwave. The best part was that we were right on the boardwalk for an affordable price. It was just me and my three little boys. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic Hotel was the filthiest place I ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: lmb1463
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking online at the pictures and reading reviews. They sent me a brochure and the contract . The contract did state only one parking space so I called them and asked about additional parking. I was told we would have a spot by our apt. and also there was another lot on the side. When we were checking in the told us the other lot was full so we would have to pay the lady across the street $75.00 to park for the week. Then we went to the apartment we rented. The maid just finished cleaning.We went to make the beds and put things away. The maid had the bedspreads all nice and neat on the bed with large blood stains all over it! The other beds also had blood all over the mattresses. The coffee pot still had coffee in it. The place had not been swept. They swept the pool only once in a week.The owner and the staff were rude and laughed at us for being upset. The owners son parked in the side lot a week while we had to pay extra! If I were someone looking to stay in Ocean City for the first time I would stay as far away from this place as possible!

Reviews.Title: “owners were intimidating”
Reviews.Author: fredmarine
Reviews.Content: hotel was old fashioned in serious need of renovation. carpets were dusty and beds were uncomfortable. location was ideal however right on boardwalk. shop downstairs extremely overpriced $10 for smokes!!! owner carries a weapon at all times which is very intimidating. pool was nice nice temperature
